name: Golden Tulip Marne La Vallee

reviews.text: This hotel is ideal for a family visiting disney or paris.
reviews.title: Great budget hotel for Disney/Paris!

likes.liked: — friendly staff and very clean hotel

reviews.text: hotel convenient to RER station for our travel into disney about 5 mins. bought a "carnet " of 10 single use tickets. tip:keep your ticket as you need it to exit at the other end. to visit Paris buy a ticket to cdg etoile follow the signs for avenue HAVOC which brings you up across from the arc de triomphe. there you can catch the hop on/off red tour bus. comes every 10mins.
reviews.title: Clean hotel very close to rail station

likes.liked: — The cleanliness and a comfortable bed
likes.disliked: — No tea or coffee making facilities or room service

reviews.text: hotel staff good english,friendly and welcoming. booked double room and triple room. double had two single beds make sure you request a double bed if required. rooms were very clean and tidy. however beds were very very firm! WARNING: may cause injury...!! hotel breakfast simple but adequate would have liked more choice.
reviews.title: clean!!

likes.disliked: — meal size & price, no tea/coffee facility in room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bussy saint georges is a lovely quiet town. good supermarkets, lovely bakery beside RER. recommend la tassili restaurant to the left of main entrance. not fussed on the chinese across the road expensive and small portions. great pizza place past the kebab shop round the corner stays open late.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - good location

likes.disliked: — Basic - but expected nothing less due to price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we would stay here again even with the hard beds!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Staff, ten gold stars

likes.liked: — Large rooms, great service, very peaceful

reviews.title: Visit to Disney and Paris
reviews.text: Tulip Inn Marne Bussy St Georges great hotel to do both places.Would recommend booking in advance theTGV from Charles de Gaulle airport to Marne La Vallee (parc Disney) as this takes approx 10 mins and costs 14.5 euros roughly the same price as the RER journey which took us over two hours.!When you get to Marne la Vallee you the have to get the RER back towards Paris for 3 stops (cost 2euros adult) but prefeable to RER all the way.

To eat out there are pizzas and chinese but also there is an Algerian restaurant called Le Tassili which serves excellent couscous even for vegeterians.(opposite main hotel entrance ,cross street top right corner)
reviews.title: Low cost - great location

reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Cheap and Convenient for Disney

likes.disliked: — how far it was from central paris

reviews.text: * Great value - helps towards the budget.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel for Disney

likes.liked: — How close it was to Disney Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * Easy access via RER to Disneyland Paris (Max. 5 minutes journey time)
reviews.title: Probably wouldn't stay here again
Well located
reviews.text: We booked this hotel on the Easyjet Holidays site - really good value for money. The hotel is clean and comfortable and location-wise perfect for the short train journety to Disney and Val de L'Europe and easy to get into Paris too. One negative - we arrived at 11 pm and the hotel does not offer room service (nor are you allowed food in your room). There was nowhere in the area to get anything to eat at that time of night so eat en route if you are going to arrive late. Another tip -the Chinese/Thai restaurant across the road is poor - both in service and food standards. That aside - I would recommend this hotel

we stayed here after a dreadful start to the holiday caused by ibis. we were without some where to stay due to the awful place we were put in. at 10pm that day of trying to find somewhere these very helpful people found us a room and bent over backwards to make sure we had a room for the week. we have a young child and they were very accomodating towards her. breakfast was good and all you can eat. rooms were very clean and tidy with beds made everyday and fresh towels. we found the rooms big enough for the 3 of us. location very handy for both disney and paris and train station is a very short walk, in addition the cost of train tickets and them being on time is excellent. little supermarket not far from hotel helped to stock up on drinks and snacks for the days in disney. the train service is easy to use and only 2 stops from disney 1 away from val de europe with its shopping centre and other ammenities, paris only approx 30 mins. we flew into orly on early flights both in and out and still hotel very accomodating and trains running to suit our flight times.
reviews.title: very helpful

likes.disliked: — not able to get snacks late on past 9.30pm

reviews.text: Stayed here for 6 nights at beginning August.
reviews.title: Fantastic base for Disneyland

likes.disliked: — Unable to use the electrical sockets!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are family of 4 including 3 & 10 year old children.
reviews.title: Great place to stay to visit Disney and Paris

reviews.text: When we arrived at CDG airport, rather than struggle with luggage, pushchair etc, onto a train, we decided to get a taxi directly to the hotel. Took around 30-40 minutes, cost 49 euros.
reviews.title: Wouldn't stay here again

likes.disliked: — It was not very clean, the service was poor, and it did not have good business services.

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel while on an EF tour. It was a modern, clean hotel, and looked like a hotel you would see near an airport in North America. We stayed here while sightseeing in Paris, so it was a bit of a pain to have to take a 45 minute RER trip anytime you wanted to get back to the hotel. However, if you were staying here while going to Disneyland Paris, it would be quite convenient, as Disneyland Paris is one or two stops from the RER and the RER station is right down the street from the hotel. Another bonus to this hotel was their excellent breakfast. If you were going to Disneyland and didn't want to spend a small fortune on eating there, you could have a very nice breakfast of fresh fruit, croissants, pain au chocolate, cereal, eggs, meat and cheese right at the Tulip Inn. The rooms were fairly spacious for European standards, and the shower and beds all seemed clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to Disneyland Paris, but I would recommend looking for a hotel closer to the center of Paris if that is where the majority of your time is going to be spent.
reviews.title: Clean, Modern Hotel, Far from Paris center but close to RER

reviews.text: Would have been a little disappointed at facilities if we were paying rack rate but via internet deal this hotel was a cost-effective functional base for a weekend at Eurodisney with room adequate for 2 adults & 2 young children.
reviews.title: Uninspired but Functional

reviews.text: We had managed to enter the wrong dates for our booking, but despite our turning up at 21H45 two days earlier than they expected, they were able to correct the booking and had a room for us with absolutely no delay or fuss. The room was immaculately clean, and larger than I expected for the three of us. Nothing whatsoever to complain about. The staff were friendly, helpful, and bilingual. It was very easy to get to and from Disney using the RER. We did not use the hotel restaurant, but preferred to get out and try the local bakeries/restaurants for breakfasts and dinners.
reviews.title: Excellent accommodating service

reviews.text: Spent 3 nights during Dec 2008 with my family, 2 adults and 2 children's.
reviews.title: Basic, Clean & Great Location to Disney Paris

reviews.text: Hotel got an underground Parking and its located with a just 10 minutes drive from Disney & Val de L'Europe shopping center.
reviews.title: Little Gem...so happy I have found!

likes.liked: — Close to Disney and very clean
likes.disliked: — No tea making facility in the room

aka: Tulip Inn Marne La Vallee Hotel
description: This hotel is ideally situated, just 5 minutes from Disneyland Resort Paris and 35 minutes from downtown Paris, directly opposite the train station. It is a 5 minute drive to the Val d'Europe shopping centre and La Vallée outlet Shopping Village. It's convenient location near to the A4 allows quick access to Porte de Bercy, Orly and Charles de Gaulle airports. The comfortably furnished and soundproof rooms all come with an en suite bathroom with a hairdryer and separate toilet. Further fittings include a direct dial telephone, satellite TV and a WiFi Internet connection.
